greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integers m, 0 < m <= n, such that n divides m(m+1)/2.
comment: Least n with a(n) = 2^k is p(k+1)#/2 = A002110(A000040(k+1))/2. Least n with a(n) = 2^k-1 != 1 is p(k+1)#.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If n is even, a(n) = 2^(omega(n)-1) - 1; if n is odd, a(n) = 2^omega(n). Here omega(n) = A001221(n) is the number of distinct prime divisors of n.
A068068(n) - a(n) = 0 if n is odd, 1 if n is even.
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 18 2002
ext: Edited by _David W. Wilson_ and _Dean Hickerson_, Jun 08 2002
